discovery_method: Manual review of UK Public Accounts Committee reports for contracted digital services

key_pac_reports.title: Government's relationship with digital technology suppliers
Digital reforms: Govt has mountain to climb

services_and_contracts.name: Digital technology suppliers (aggregate)
services_and_contracts.data_quality: No central record of spending (third-party estimates)
services_and_contracts.supplier_count: Multiple (market concentration with few large suppliers)

services_and_contracts.name: Digital Commercial Centre of Excellence
services_and_contracts.parent_organization: DSIT (Department for Science, Innovation and Technology)
services_and_contracts.comparison: 24 digital experts vs 6,000 general commercial personnel

services_and_contracts.name: HM Prison & Probation Service - Electronic Tagging Programme
services_and_contracts.status: Failed delivery cited in PAC reports

key_findings.data_management: No central record of digital procurement spending
key_findings.supplier_relationships: 15 full-time staff manage all technology supplier relationships
key_findings.market_concentration: Digital technology market dominated by small number of large suppliers
key_findings.skills_gap: 24 digital experts in Digital Commercial Centre of Excellence vs 6,000 general commercial staff
key_findings.legacy_systems: 28% of central government systems are outdated legacy IT
key_findings.transformation_timeline: Government has mountain to climb, does not understand scale of challenge
key_findings.procurement_inefficiencies: Compounded by lack of digital skills in civil service

pac_recommendations.requirement: Ensure government has data and capability to make informed decisions about technology spending
Address market concentration and limited supplier choice
Improve digital skills and commercial capabilities
Create central record of digital procurement spending
Scale up Digital Commercial Centre of Excellence staffing

digital_sourcing_strategy.lead: DSIT (Department for Science, Innovation and Technology)

organizational_changes.merger: GDS, CDDO, Incubator for Artificial Intelligence, Geospatial Commission, parts of Responsible Tech Adoption Unit
organizational_changes.parent: Department for Science, Innovation and Technology (DSIT)

topics_examined: Government's relationship with digital technology suppliers

notes: PAC reports highlight systemic issues in digital procurement
Government lacks central visibility of £14bn annual digital spending
Only 15 people manage full-time relationships with all technology suppliers
Digital Commercial Centre of Excellence significantly understaffed (24 vs needs)
28% of government systems are legacy IT requiring modernization
Market concentration limits government choice of suppliers
Electronic tagging programme cited as example of digital project failure
PAC report URLs return 403 errors (restricted access)
Government committed to delivering reforms by autumn 2025
sources: UK Parliament Public Accounts Committee reports (2024-2025)
